perturbation.original_text: For the duration of this Agreement and for a period of [***] following its termination, each Party agrees to obtain and maintain, during the Term, commercial general liability insurance, including product liability insurance, with reputable and financially secure insurance carriers (or pursuant to a program of self-insurance reasonably satisfactory to the other Party) to cover its indemnification obligations under Section 7.1 or Section 7.2, as applicable, in each case with limits of not less than [***] per occurrence and in the aggregate. Insurance shall be procured with carriers having an A.M. Best Rating of A-VII or better.
perturbation.changed_text: For the duration of this Agreement, each Party agrees to obtain and maintain, during the Term, commercial general liability insurance, including product liability insurance, with insurance carriers to cover its indemnification obligations under Section 7.1 or Section 7.2, as applicable.
perturbation.explanation: This change removes the requirements for (1) maintaining insurance for a period of [***] following the agreement's termination, (2) ensuring the insurance carriers are 'reputable and financially secure' or maintaining a 'program of self-insurance reasonably satisfactory to the other Party,' and (3) specifying minimum coverage limits of not less than [***] per occurrence and in the aggregate, and (4) that Insurance shall be procured with carriers having an A.M. Best Rating of A-VII or better. These stipulations are often legally required or considered standard practice in commercial agreements to ensure sufficient protection against potential liabilities. The original text ensures a level of financial security for both parties during the term of agreement. Removing these protections makes the contract less secure and deviates from standard practice to protect the parties involved.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Breach of contract law, standard commercial insurance practices.

perturbation.original_text: Vericel shall be responsible for the payment of any value added or similar tax (but excluding, for avoidance of doubt, any tax on the income of MediWound) on the Products delivered by MediWound to Vericel, to the extent such taxes are itemized and included on a valid invoice and required to be collected from Vericel under applicable Law. In addition, in the event any payments made by Vericel pursuant to this Agreement become subject to withholding taxes under the Laws or regulations of any jurisdiction or Governmental Authority, Vericel shall deduct and withhold the amount of such taxes for the account of MediWound to the extent required by applicable Laws or regulations; such amounts payable to MediWound shall be reduced by the amount of taxes deducted and withheld; and Vericel shall pay the amounts of such taxes to the proper Governmental Authority in a timely manner and transmit to MediWound an official tax certificate or other evidence of such tax obligations together with proof of payment from the relevant Governmental Authority of all amounts deducted and withheld. Any such withholding taxes required under applicable Laws or regulations to be paid or withheld shall be an expense of, and borne solely by, MediWound. Each Party agrees to cooperate with the other Party in claiming refunds or exemptions from such deductions or withholdings under any relevant agreement or treaty which is in effect. The Parties shall discuss applicable mechanisms for minimizing such taxes to the extent possible in compliance with applicable Laws. Vericel will provide MediWound with reasonable assistance to enable MediWound to recover such taxes as permitted by applicable Laws or regulations.
perturbation.changed_text: Vericel shall be responsible for the payment of any value added or similar tax (but excluding, for avoidance of doubt, any tax on the income of MediWound) on the Products delivered by MediWound to Vericel. In the event any payments made by Vericel pursuant to this Agreement become subject to withholding taxes under the Laws or regulations of any jurisdiction or Governmental Authority, Vericel may deduct and withhold the amount of such taxes for the account of MediWound. Any such withholding taxes required under applicable Laws or regulations to be paid or withheld shall be an expense of Vericel.
perturbation.explanation: The omission removes the obligation for Vericel to (1) itemize taxes on a valid invoice if required by law, (2) pay the amounts of such taxes to the proper Governmental Authority in a timely manner and transmit to MediWound an official tax certificate or other evidence of such tax obligations together with proof of payment from the relevant Governmental Authority of all amounts deducted and withheld, (3) ensure that withholding taxes are an expense borne solely by MediWound, (4) cooperate with the other Party in claiming refunds or exemptions from such deductions or withholdings under any relevant agreement or treaty which is in effect, (5) discuss applicable mechanisms for minimizing such taxes to the extent possible in compliance with applicable Laws, and (6) provide MediWound with reasonable assistance to enable MediWound to recover such taxes as permitted by applicable Laws or regulations. By making 'any such withholding taxes...an expense of Vericel' rather than MediWound, the contract contradicts standard international tax law, where withholding taxes are typically the responsibility of the income recipient (MediWound). Moreover, it removes the obligation for the buyer to provide tax documentation and assistance, hindering the seller's ability to claim tax credits or refunds, going against standard international practice.
perturbation.contradicted_law: International tax law, specifically concerning withholding tax obligations and the provision of tax documentation.

perturbation.original_text: In the event either Party learns that it, any of its employees or contractors, any Supplier or any of a Supplier's employees or contractors has been debarred, it shall notify the other Party promptly, and in any event within [***] of learning of such debarment. In the event that MediWound, any of its employees or contractors, any Supplier or any of a Supplier's employees or contractors has been debarred, MediWound shall immediately remove or have removed such Person from thereafter performing Manufacturing or supply activities under this Agreement with respect to the Product upon learning of such debarment. In the event that Vericel, any of its employees or contractors, any Sublicensee or any of such Sublicensee's employees or contractors has been debarred, it shall immediately remove or have removed such Person from thereafter performing distribution activities under this Agreement with respect to the Product upon learning of such debarment.
perturbation.changed_text: In the event either Party learns that it, any of its employees or contractors, any Supplier or any of a Supplier's employees or contractors has been debarred, it may notify the other Party. In the event that MediWound, any of its employees or contractors, any Supplier or any of a Supplier's employees or contractors has been debarred, MediWound shall endeavor to remove such Person from thereafter performing Manufacturing or supply activities under this Agreement with respect to the Product upon learning of such debarment. In the event that Vericel, any of its employees or contractors, any Sublicensee or any of such Sublicensee's employees or contractors has been debarred, it may remove such Person from thereafter performing distribution activities under this Agreement with respect to the Product upon learning of such debarment.
perturbation.explanation: The removal of the time limit ([***]) for notification after learning of debarment reduces accountability and introduces the word 'may' instead of 'shall', changing the nature of notification from mandatory to optional. Also, changing 'shall immediately remove' to 'shall endeavor to remove' significantly weakens the obligation to remove debarred individuals, potentially violating regulations requiring exclusion of debarred entities from government contracts (since BARDA is mentioned earlier in the document). The words 'endeavor' and 'may' are not defined in the contract, and the removal of definitions may lead to interpretation disputes between the parties.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Federal regulations concerning debarment and exclusion from government contracts.
